label: 藤原兼家
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Fujiwara no Kaneie (J.) 藤原兼家, also called 法興院、東三条殿 Hōkō'in, Higashi sanjō dono. This son of the powerful Morosuke (908-960) vied successfully with his brother Kanemichi (925-77) for the position of regent, and later became chancellor and minister of the right as well. Kane'ie also orchestrated the abdication of emperor Kazan and the accession of Ichjō in 986, and died in 990.
